articles.title: Osinbajo departs Abuja to attend Queen Elizabeth's funeral in London - Premium Times
articles.description: Mr Osinbajo will join other world leaders, politicians, public figures and European royals, as well as more than 500 dignitaries from around the world invited by the royal family to lay Britain's longest reigning monarch to rest.
articles.content:
Nigeria’s Vice President, Yemi Osinbajo, on Saturday, departed Abuja for London to attend the funeral of late Queen Elizabeth II.

articles.title: Young Scientist winners take top prize at EU contest - TheJournal.ie
articles.description: Aditya Kumar and Aditya Joshi took first prize at the European Union Contest for Young Scientists.
articles.content:
THE WINNERS OF this years BT Young Scientist and Technology Exhibition have won the top prize at the European Union Contest for Young Scientists (EUCYS).

articles.title: Burial site with 445 bodies outside Izyum shows evidence of war crimes, Ukraine says - The Globe and Mail
articles.description: Hundreds of bodies discovered in the newly liberated Kharkiv region would represent the biggest unmarked grave in Europe since the aftermath of the Balkan wars of the 1990s
articles.content: Most of the graves outside Izyum, which could represent the largest mass burial discovered in Europe since the Balkan wars of the 1990s ,were marked only with a simple cross and a number.Anton Skyba/… [+7571 chars]
